summary.p: Bullinger's daughters Anna and Elisabeth announced that they would return [to Zurich] tomorrow, therefore Panizzone writes him this letter out of old friendship. The Burgundian envoy [Fran√ßois Bonvalot or Jean de Saint-Mauris] was about to travel to the Zurichers regarding the Burgundian neutrality; Panizzone wants to know if he has arrived. The mediators between the warring rulers [Emperor Charles V and King Francis I] are working towards peace; Panizzone requests further information in this regard; regards to Bullinger's wife and children; has become the godfather of Jakob, the son of Werner Bullinger, today.

div.p: Most illustrious man and my most esteemed lord.

Your daughters Anna and Elisabeth, beautiful offspring, said after dinner that they would return to you tomorrow. Therefore, to renew our old friendship, I have decided to greet you with this letter, so that you may know that I am yours as usual, to whom you can command, and I will always obey and serve you, as I am bound and as befits our friendship, which I wish to preserve forever.

Furthermore, a Burgundian envoy was about to come to the lords of Zurich regarding the neutrality of Burgundy. If he has come, I would gladly understand for your convenience upon the return of the people of Bremgarten from the festival being celebrated there.

I have nothing new, except that mediators between the two warring majesties are working for peace. If you have any news, I ask that it not be burdensome to make me a participant in your letters; to whom and to your wife and all your children I commend myself from the heart and inform you that today I have become the godfather of your Werner Bullinger's son, to whom a beautiful child was born and was named Jakob in baptism.
Your Panizzone, acting on behalf of the emperor.
To the most illustrious man and my lord, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, in Zurich.
